title: Squish Summon
description: What if you could summon far away objects to you by squishing them? A short interaction exploration, that feels like magic.
imageAlt: A person playing with 3D shapes on a pedestal. When they aim their hand towards a shape and make a fist, the shape disappears, and as they uncurl their fist, it appears above their hand, allowing them to catch it.

title: Single Handed Menu
description: An exploration into making hand menus more accessible - allowing you to pull menus off your hand, and reattach them back in one smooth motion
imageAlt: A person with a music player ui attached to their hand. They make a fist and pull it away from the UI to detach it from their hand. They make a fist and bring their hand near the UI to reattach it back.

title: Barista: Marker Edition
description: Barista is an app made to demonstrate the combination of ultraleap's hand on object model, and fiducial marker tracking. I designed the application, researched into fiducial marker interaction & tested it, all under a short deadline.
imageAlt: A person interacting with a virtual coffee machine, using real world props, which have fiducial markers attached

title: Microgestures
description: Microgestures is a small app made to show off the microgesture capabilities of Ultraleap' Hyperion release. I helped design and build the app, from design mockups to interaction research & user studies.
imageAlt: A person interacting with generic uis, by swiping their thumb along their index finger.

title: Tabs, Pads and Boards
description: A prototype inspired by ubiquitous computing, reimagining how responsive UI works for XR - letting apps adapt to their spatial context.

title: Pomodoro.
description: Pomodoro. is a satisfying, minimal pomodoro timer for the Playdate console, focused on keeping you in your flow

title: Dog Racer
description: Internal game jam @Ultraleap on Spatial Interactions for 2D screens - resulting in a silly dog racing game

title: Aurora
description: I helped build Aurora - a demo showing off how powerful hand tracking can be in XR. Paint, play & explore, all with your hands.
imageAlt: A run through of someone interacting with a robot, painting with their hands, playing with blocks and exploring an XR headset.

links.text: See some of my favourite details,

title: XR Design Guidelines
description: I helped rework Ultraleap's XR Guidelines - providing guidance and insight into our best recommendations for XR Hand Tracking interactions.
imageAlt: A picture of the first page in ultraleap's XR guidelines.

links.text: Learn how to best use hands in XR,

title: MR Owltraleap
description: An internal hackathon proj, MR Owltraleap is a Mixed Reality, virtual owl. I worked primarily on the flying mechanic.
imageAlt: A first person perspective of a virtual cartoon owl hopping onto someones finger, and then flying around a room.

title: Black Hole Storage
description: A study on spatial storage solutions, and conveying tension through visual feedback of FABRIK chains. Black holes are a virtual pocket, in which you can store Interaction Behaviours, and nest other Black Holes inside.
imageAlt: A purple sphere is dragged into a black sphere by a pink hand made of capsules. The black sphere is then tapped, at which point 3 purple spheres appear from inside of it. Each purple sphere is connected to black sphere by a white tendril. A purple sphere is grabbed and pulled until its tendril becomes taut and eventually breaks. The black sphere is then tapped again, bringing all purple spheres back into it, aside from the one which was pulled off of it.

title: Hand Rays
description: I created a new way of generating a stable hand ray, which iterates on the standard shoulder through pinch position, taking into account wrist position to introduce more expressiveness to the ray, whilst keeping the stability.
imageAlt: A hand with a ray directed from it, entering a scene with three floating gray squares. It aims at the middle square, then the right repeatedly. When the ray hits the squares they turn purple. The hand then leaves the scene.

links.text: Clone the Ultraleap Unity Plugin Preview Package: Hand Rays,

title: Ultraleap Control Panel
description: I helped build the Ultraleap Control Panel - an application which lets you view your hands, diagnose issues with your hand tracking and easily edit hand tracking settings.
imageAlt: Two skeletal hands with spheres between each joint - one red, one purple. A 2D UI is above them, with camera settings.

links.text: Download Ultraleap Gemini Tracking, and its control panel,

title: GDC 2022
description: I spoke at GDC 2022 with Chris Burgess on "Hand Tracking: How can lessons from LBE can help at home gaming?". We then wrote the talk up into a blogpost post-event.
imageAlt: Two men (Pip Turner & Chris Burgess) pointing at their talk title on a digital screen.

title: p5.js Explorations
description: I messed around with generative art and p5.js. I mainly focused on exploiting flow fields and perlin noise.
imageAlt: Colourful curves are drawn on an orange background, generated with a flow field.

title: XR Controller and Hand Swapping
description: I helped create an algorithm which allows for super quick swapping between xr controllers and hand tracking.
imageAlt: Someone picking up and putting xr controllers down, and the onscreen hands swapping between controllers and hands

title: Amazeing Escape
description: Made during an internal game jam at ultraleap. A top down stealth puzzler, focused on showing off far field interactions.
imageAlt: A right hand with a ray coming from it. The right hand pinches to place a marker in a maze, which a yellow sphere moves towards. Behind the sphere, a cube with a hat on it patrols the maze, its field of view visualised on the floor.

title: XR Launcher
description: I helped build an xr launcher (windows & xr2 headsets). This was built to prove that hand tracking is as viable as controllers for day to day tasks.
imageAlt: A left hand turns over to reveal a button on its palm. A right hand presses the button to make a UI panel appear.

title: Blocks
description: I helped rebuild blocks - a hand tracking physics playground which shows off the power of simple interactions, combined with Ultraleap's interaction engine.
imageAlt: Hands knocking over a pile of cubes

title: XR Keyboard
description:
I built and wrote about an open source, reusable, physical xr keyboard made to be used with ultraleap hand tracking and easy for novice users to get started with.

It has been described as "the best keyboard i've tried in vr with hand tracking".
imageAlt: Low poly hands in VR typing Hello World on a keyboard

title: Touchfree
description: I spent a year researching how to build great touch-less experiences for out of home kiosks. This research helped form the basis of ultraleap's touchfree application & tooling.
imageAlt: A pointed hand moving towards a screen

title: ALD Direct
description: I spent a year working at ALD Automotive on ALD Direct - a series of car leasing websites.  I maintained and iterated upon car leasing websites for a number of household names, utilising .NET & Angular technologies. I also helped design, maintain and iterate upon their selenium automated testing.
imageAlt: A pointed hand moving towards a screen

title: 3D Procedurally Generated Nature Scene
description: Made for my final year dissertation. A nature scene made with procedural generation algorithms (DiamondSquare, and L-Systems).
imageAlt: Procedurally generated mountain scene

title: Pip Writes Stuff/ Itching For More
description: I ran an alt-games & poetry blog from 2014 to 2017, posting twice weekly. I featured small, relatively unknown games found on itch.io, as well as interviewing their creators. My writing was featured twice in Rock Paper Shotgun's "Sunday Papers", and contributed to TRASHZINE
imageAlt: A screenshot of a blog on medium

title: Three JS Adventure Scene
description: 3D Scene made in ThreeJS for a Computer Graphics And Games module. Features a tree made with a space colonisation algorithm.
imageAlt: Scene made with ThreeJS

title: The Search For A Good Book
description: A low poly animation made in Blender, for an Applied Graphics module.
imageAlt: A spaceship lands on a dark planet

title: QRTTNBPBYTROAYALID
description: Quick, Run to The Next Battery Pack Before Your Torch Runs Out and You Are Left In Darkness!, (or QRTTNBPBYTROAYALID), an infinite runner created with Poppy Lomax for Ludum Dare #39. I worked on the code & game feel.
imageAlt: A pixel art infinite runner, set in a cave

title: Buccaneer
description: A remake of the board game Buccaneer in Java, made for a Group Project module. I was lead architect, ensuring that the backend of the project interacted nicely with the UI.
imageAlt: A pixel art pirate game

title: Rare Cover Letter
description: An interactive cover letter I made in a few days in order to apply to Rare's Industrial Placement. They specified that they wanted something creative, instead of a normal cover letter - so I made this.
imageAlt: A pixel art image of a man walking through a city

title: Space Invaders
description: The first Unity project I ever finished! A Space Invaders clone (with a small twist), made as a way to become more familiar with Unity. SFX provided by xeno_
imageAlt: A webp of a space invaders clone
